title: How to Convert Docx to PDF in Mobile

steps.title: Open Google Drive.
steps.content: Open Google Drive. This app icon looks like a green, yellow, blue, and red triangle. If you don't have the mobile app, you can download it for free.

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . This plus sign is in the lower right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Upload.
steps.content: Tap Upload . You're going to need to upload your .docx document to Google Drive before you can convert it.

steps.title: Navigate to and select the DOCX file.
steps.content: Navigate to and select the DOCX file. You can search your recent files or look in other places of your local storage by tapping the three-line menu icon. Once you select your .docx file, it will begin uploading to your Google Drive.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . Once it's finished uploading, tap the three-dot menu next to your .docx file.

steps.title: Tap Print.
steps.content: Tap Print . It's next to an icon of a printer towards the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Tap "Save as PDF" from the drop-down menu (if it's not already selected).
steps.content: Tap "Save as PDF" from the drop-down menu (if it's not already selected). The drop-down menu is at the very top of your screen. If you have any available printers, those will show up here. Set it to "Save as PDF" and the document will convert from .docx to .pdf.

steps.title: Tap the Save to PDF icon.
steps.content: Tap the Save to PDF icon. It looks like a download icon pointing to "PDF." You will be prompted to save the file locally on your phone or tablet. Tap Save once you have chosen a location to save the PDF document. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open Smallpdf.
steps.content: Open Smallpdf. The app icon looks like a multicolor grid in the shape of a square. If you don't have Smallpdf, you can download it for free from both the Google Play Store (Android) and App Store (iOS). Smallpdf is a free, very popular, and highly rated app that will convert your files easily.

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . The plus sign is centered at the bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Files.
steps.content: Tap Files . You'll see this option next to an icon of a folder to the far right.

steps.title: Navigate to and select the DOCX file you want to convert to PDF.
steps.content: Navigate to and select the DOCX file you want to convert to PDF. You can search around your local storage or use your cloud storage.

steps.title: Tap ⋮ next to the DOCX document.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ next to the DOCX document. A menu will appear.

steps.title: Tap Convert to PDF.
steps.content: Tap Convert to PDF . It's usually the first item in the menu. You'll see the PDF version of your file appear in the list. You can then tap to open that file, then download or share it to others. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open your project in Word.
steps.content: Open your project in Word. The app icon looks like a blue rectangle with a white "W" on it. You should be prompted to open a project as soon as you launch Word. If not, go to File > Open and choose the document you want to convert to PDF.

steps.title: Tap File.
steps.content: Tap File . It's in the editing ribbon above your workspace.

steps.title: Tap Print.
steps.content: Tap Print . You'll see this option near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Tap "Save as PDF" from the drop-down menu (if it's not already selected).
steps.content: Tap "Save as PDF" from the drop-down menu (if it's not already selected). If the drop-down option already lists "Save as PDF," you can skip this step.

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . This button is at the bottom of the window and will prompt another window to pop up.

steps.title: Choose a location to save your PDF to, name it, then tap Save.
steps.content: Choose a location to save your PDF to, name it, then tap Save . The PDF document will default to the same name as the DOCX file, so you may want to rename it to avoid confusion.
